content.description: This route follows the first lower section of the previous routes. Pitch 1: When you get to the top of the rock slab continue up to the right to a steep arete. Follow the crack on the corner to a small belay. Pitch 2: Traverse right out of the belay to the overhang. Work your way around the corner to a small ledge by a wide crack. Climb the crack up for a couple of moves and then onto the face on the left. Follow this to the top.
content.location: Same start location as 'Class Four Ramp'.

content.description: This route starts 5 feet right of ‘Class Four Ramp’. Climb the left-facing arete to the top without using the wide crack on the upper section. Liebacks help up higher. This is a fun route on this wall.

This route starts 25 feet right of ‘Gymnastical Jazz’. There’s a large inset where this route starts. Scramble up the blocks to a dirt ramp and then up the low-angle rock ramp. Climb left at the top of the ramp and follow the dihedral to the top.
content.protection: Small to mid cams and a set of stoppers (basic gap rack). One large cam works for the upper section.

content.description: This route starts in the same location as ‘Class Four Ramp’. At the top of the low-angle rock ramp step left to a small ledge. Traverse left for 5 to 10 feet and then up next to the arete to the top.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 1 large cam, set of stoppers, small tri-cams.

content.description: A large, obvious chimney on the left side while heading uphill on the baseline trail. This is a popular descent route from the top of the lower headwall.
